results.title: Skyfall
results.creator_credit: Robby Susanto, Lu Gao and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Great collaboration between a 2D and 3D animator to create a composite of cutout animation styles. A series of landscapes are degraded by human activities, in a dreamlike meditation on the despoilment of nature.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Opposites attract
results.creator_credit: Elin Bakken Tonder and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A shy retiring little man and his glamourous neighbour share meaningful looks as they pass each other in the hallway. He is entranced by her ravishing outfits, she is a little lonely and thinks ‘why not?’. But there is a twist in the tale of this claymation. Music by Matt Archer.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Elin Bakken Tonder and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT

results.title: Fluid
results.creator_credit: Lachlan Dean and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
An animated ink blot transverses the treacherous terrain contained within a sketchbook of ideas as scarey doodles attack it from every side.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Roundabout winter
results.brief_description:
This stylised short film explores what happens when a happily married second hand bookstore owner flings herself into an extra-marital affair. Unsure of her motivations, the adulterer seeks solace in the bookshelves. Original music by Warran Wright.
Graduate work from RMIT media arts (BA Arts).

results.title: Road to Alice
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Frances McGivern and Stavros Kazantzidis
results.brief_description: Jimmy (Noah Taylor) owes Dimitri more money than he can spare. He decides that a holiday would be a better bet. On his travels he meets Louis (Hugo Weaving) and things start to go wrong. Cast also includes Helen Buday, Leone Carmen, Angelo D’Angelo, Emil Minty. Best Short Film, AFI Awards (1992). Original format 16mm/colour.

results.title: Violence is Violence
results.creator_credit: SKA TV, Campbell Manderson and Pip Starr
results.brief_description: A report on the concerns over the private toll road which was built at the expense of over 2 hectares of public parkland in inner Sydney. Hundreds of Sydney residents take over the streets to protest car-dominated public space and offer a vision of urban sustainability. Their celebration is met with a brutal police response. Produced as a news story for SKA TV’s Access News, a grass-roots alternative to mainstream news and current affairs, broadcast weekly on Melbourne’s Community Television station Channel 31 since 1994.

results.title: Getting wet
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Chris Fitchett and P.J. Hogan
results.brief_description: Fifteen-year-old Alex has always adored Brenda, who has helped his mother around the house for years, but she hardly notices him. When his mother asks Brenda to go on their annual beach holiday to help her out, Alex thinks his chance has come to impress her. But, as usual, it is his older brother Michael who gets the girl. Alex thinks he will never be happy again - until he meets Margaret and his adolescent fantasies come true.

results.title: Flux
results.brief_description:
A film about trust, about an accident, about falling out of love and about emerging from grief. Flux was created entirely on a desktop Macintosh using Adobe AfterEffects and Adobe Photoshop. It was then transferred to 35mm film using a Solitair Film Recorder. It is listed by Lynden Barber (film critic for The Australian newspaper) as one of ‘12 Film Breakthroughs’ for its achievement as the first Australian film post-produced entirely on a home computer.
WARNING: This film contains scenes that may disturb some viewers.
